@shermant/logger

Lightweight Multi-platform Logger

A graceful, chainable, and cross-platform logging solution for modern JavaScript applications

Get Started
View on GitHub
üîó

Chainable API

Fluent interface design allows for elegant method chaining to build complex log messages with ease.

üé®

Rich Styling

Built-in support for colors, backgrounds, and text decorations using Chalk.js styling system.

üåê

Cross-Platform

Works seamlessly in Node.js, Bun, and browser environments with automatic feature detection.

‚ö°

Zero Dependencies

Core functionality has no required dependencies. Optional enhancements available with chalk and ora.

üîß

TypeScript First

Written in TypeScript with full type safety and excellent IntelliSense support.

üì¶

Lightweight

Minimal bundle size with tree-shaking support for optimal performance in any environment.

üéØ

Custom Types

Easily create and register custom logger types with your own styling and behavior.

üìä

Stream Support

Built-in streaming logger for real-time updates and progress indicators.

Quick Example ‚Äã

typescript
import { logger } from '@shermant/logger'

// Simple logging
logger.info.text('Application started').print()

// Chainable with styling
logger.success
  .prefix('‚úÖ SUCCESS')
  .text('Database connected successfully')
  .detail('Connection established in 150ms')
  .print()

// Custom types
logger
  .type('custom', ['bgMagenta', 'bold'])
  .prefix('CUSTOM')
  .text('This is a custom log type')
  .print()

// Stream logging for progress
const stream = logger.stream
stream.prefix('üì¶ Installing').text('packages...').update()

Installation ‚Äã

bash
bun add @shermant/logger

npm install @shermant/logger

Why Choose Sherman Logger? ‚Äã

  • Developer Experience: Intuitive API that feels natural to use
  • Performance: Optimized for both development and production environments
  • Flexibility: Extensible design allows for custom logging patterns
  • Reliability: Comprehensive test suite ensures consistent behavior
  • Modern: Built with modern JavaScript/TypeScript best practices
